topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

topItems.excerpt: Discover Azure's three approaches to deploying cloud resources -- public, private, and hybrid -- and learn the difference each makes in your Azure services.

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up policies to classify, retain, and protect your cloud-based data.

value.title: Choose the best tools to help organizations build better solutions
value.excerpt: Learn about Microsoft tools and services that help developers and operations engineers build modern solutions for the cloud and on-premises.

value.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product
value.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to our end users. Discover the first two foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 6: Describe Azure cost management and service level agreements
value.excerpt: Learn about the factors that influence cost, tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend, and how Azure's service-level agreements (SLAs) can impact your application design decisions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
topItems.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

topItems.title: Choose the right Azure services by examining SLAs and service lifecycle
topItems.excerpt: Learn about service-level agreements (SLAs) in Azure, and how they can affect your application design decisions. See how to access preview services and learn how they affect your planning.

value.title: Define the foundation pillars of DevOps: Architecture and Technology
value.excerpt: There are three things required to make DevOps happen: the cultural component, tools and technology, and architecture. Discover the last two foundation pillars of DevOps, Architecture and Technology!

value.title: Choose the best tools for managing and configuring your Azure environment
value.excerpt: Explore the Azure management, administration, and reporting tools, and choose the ones that best meet your organization's needs.

value.title: Choose the best monitoring service for visibility, insight, and mitigation of service outages
value.excerpt: Discover solutions that help IT organizations with insights into the health and performance of their applications running in the cloud.

value.title: Choose the best Azure serverless technology for your compute scenario
value.excerpt: Examine Azure's serverless technologies and choose the right service for your scenario.

value.title: Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Join Scott Hanselman, Donovan Brown, and Lara Rubbelke as they host the engineers who build & use Azure, demo it, answer questions, and share insights.

topItems.title: Introducing Flexible Server in Azure Database for PostgreSQL & MySQL | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: Sunil Kamath joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how you can run your MySQL or Postgres database as a managed database on Azure without giving up the control you want while taking advantage of the benefits of a PaaS offering.  0:00 – Overview 4:44 – Demo 8:54 – Customizing Flexible Server in the CLI 10:41
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oFlKRdr0MLE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Using Entity Framework Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: Jeremy Likness shows Scott Hanselman how to use Entity Framework (EF) Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB. EF Core is a lightweight, extensible, open source, and cross-platform version of the popular Entity Framework data access technology.  0:00 – Overview 1:43 – Using Entity Framework Core with
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FFgS_k_Muk8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Bring compute, storage, and intelligence to the edge with Azure Stack Edge | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: Dipti Pai joins Scott Hanselman to show how to run containerized and VM workloads to get quick, actionable insights at the edge—where data is created—using purpose-built hardware-as-a-service with Azure Stack Edge.  0:00 – Overview 0:55 – What is Azure Stack Edge? 4:09 – Azure Stack Edge in the house
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RHec5lNuYqQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Using Azure Container Registry for building and deploying .NET Core Apps | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: You probably know that Azure Container Registry enables you to store and manage container images securely, but did you know it can also be used as a part of your DevOps pipelines? Jeremy Likness shows Scott Hanselman how ACR can manage your images and even build them for you in the cloud.   0:00 – Overview
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VcZH6AWhUGk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow you to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning server infrastructure

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop an instrumentation strategy
value.excerpt: Develop an effective instrumentation strategy through logging, telemetry, and monitoring and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Learn about how to capture trace output from your Azure web apps. View a live log stream and download logs files for offline analysis.

topItems.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

topItems.title: Introduction to App Center
topItems.excerpt: Explore Azure App services to find ways to simplify creation and integration as you build, distribute, test, and analyze usage of yours apps.

topItems.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
topItems.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

value.title: Work with relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to Azure-supported SQL-based enterprise data solutions enabling you to store and retrieve your app's data in the cloud.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Database for PostgreSQL server
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create and deploy Azure Database for PostgreSQL for fully managed, enterprise-ready PostgreSQL database services.

topItems.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

value.title: Choose a data storage approach in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how using Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Cosmos DB - or a combination of them - for your business scenario is the best way to get the most performant solution.

value.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn to create an Azure virtual machine in minutes that can be used like a local physical desktop or server.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure networking options
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with Azure networking basics to find out how Azure networking helps improve resiliency and reduce latency.

value.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
value.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

value.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

value.title: AZ-104: Monitor and back up Azure resources
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and back up Azure resources and prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

topItems.title: Monitor the health of your Azure virtual machine by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to monitor the health of your Azure VMs by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts.

topItems.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

topItems.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a security and compliance plan
value.excerpt: Build strategies around security and compliance and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Active Directory to you secure your internal, external, and customer identities.

topItems.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory.

topItems.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
topItems.excerpt: Securely authenticate apps to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities give your app an Azure AD identity.
